description: From Middle English duren (“to last”), from Old French durer, from Latin durāre. Related to Dutch duren (“to last, dure”), German dauern (“to last, dure”).

verbs.description: dure (third-person singular simple present dures, present participle during, simple past and past participle dured)

description: From Latin dūrus. Doublet of dour.

adjectives.description: dure (comparative more dure, superlative most dure)

examples: The winter is severe, and life is dure and rude.
